result.markdown:
---
title: "9: Simple Normal Regression"
editor_options: 
  chunk_output_type: console
---

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
# Load packages
library(bayesrules)
library(tidyverse)
library(rstan)
library(rstanarm)
library(bayesplot)
library(tidybayes)
library(janitor)
library(broom.mixed)
```
:::


# 9.2 Tuning prior models for regression parameters


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
plot_normal(mean = 5000, sd = 1000) + 
  labs(x = "beta_0c", y = "pdf")
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](09_notes_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-2-1.png){width=672}
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
plot_normal(mean = 100, sd = 40) + 
  labs(x = "beta_1", y = "pdf")
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](09_notes_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-2-2.png){width=672}
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
plot_gamma(shape = 1, rate = 0.0008) + 
  labs(x = "sigma", y = "pdf")
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](09_notes_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-2-3.png){width=672}
:::
:::


# 9.3 Posterior simulation


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
# Load and plot data
data(bikes)

ggplot(bikes, aes(x = temp_feel, y = rides)) + 
  geom_point(size = 1.5) + 
  geom_smooth(method = "lm", se = FALSE, linewidth = 2)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](09_notes_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-3-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


# 9.3.1 Simulation via rstanarm


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
bike_model <- stan_glm(rides ~ temp_feel, data = bikes,
                       family = gaussian,
                       prior_intercept = normal(5000, 1000),
                       prior = normal(100, 40), 
                       prior_aux = exponential(0.0008),
                       chains = 4, iter = 5000*2, seed = 84735)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

:::

```{.r .cell-code}
# Effective sample size ratio and Rhat
neff_ratio(bike_model)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
(Intercept)   temp_feel       sigma 
    1.01655     1.00960     0.98635 
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
rhat(bike_model)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
(Intercept)   temp_feel       sigma 
  0.9999477   0.9999072   0.9999549 
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
# Trace plots of parallel chains
mcmc_trace(bike_model, size = 0.1)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](09_notes_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-4-1.png){width=672}
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
# Density plots of parallel chains
mcmc_dens_overlay(bike_model)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](09_notes_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-4-2.png){width=672}
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
saveRDS(bike_model, "bike_model.RDS")
```
:::


# 9.3.2 Optional: Simulation via rstan


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
# STEP 1: DEFINE the model
stan_bike_model <- "
  data {
    int<lower = 0> n;
    vector[n] Y;
    vector[n] X;
  }
  parameters {
    real beta0;
    real beta1;
    real<lower = 0> sigma;
  }
  model {
    Y ~ normal(beta0 + beta1 * X, sigma);
    beta0 ~ normal(-2000, 1000);
    beta1 ~ normal(100, 40);
    sigma ~ exponential(0.0008);
  }
"
# STEP 2: SIMULATE the posterior
stan_bike_sim <- 
  stan(model_code = stan_bike_model, 
       data = list(n = nrow(bikes), Y = bikes$rides, X = bikes$temp_feel), 
       chains = 4, iter = 5000*2, seed = 84735)
```

# 9.4 Interpreting the posterior


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
# Posterior summary statistics
tidy(bike_model, effects = c("fixed", "aux"),
     conf.int = TRUE, conf.level = 0.80)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
# A tibble: 4 Ã— 5
  term        estimate std.error conf.low conf.high
  <chr>          <dbl>     <dbl>    <dbl>     <dbl>
1 (Intercept)  -2195.     359.    -2657.    -1741. 
2 temp_feel       82.2      5.05     75.7      88.8
3 sigma         1282.      40.6    1232.     1336. 
4 mean_PPD      3487.      80.8    3383.     3590. 
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
# Store the 4 chains for each parameter in 1 data frame
bike_model_df <- as.data.frame(bike_model)

# Check it out
nrow(bike_model_df)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
[1] 20000
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
head(bike_model_df, 3)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
  (Intercept) temp_feel    sigma
1   -2593.578  87.59029 1362.773
2   -2207.766  82.06586 1236.125
3   -2515.712  86.25428 1329.203
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
# 50 simulated model lines
bikes %>%
  add_fitted_draws(bike_model, n = 50) %>%
  ggplot(aes(x = temp_feel, y = rides)) +
    geom_line(aes(y = .value, group = .draw), alpha = 0.15) + 
    geom_point(data = bikes, size = 0.05)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}
```
Warning: `fitted_draws` and `add_fitted_draws` are deprecated as their names were confusing.
- Use [add_]epred_draws() to get the expectation of the posterior predictive.
- Use [add_]linpred_draws() to get the distribution of the linear predictor.
- For example, you used [add_]fitted_draws(..., scale = "response"), which
  means you most likely want [add_]epred_draws(...).
NOTE: When updating to the new functions, note that the `model` parameter is now
  named `object` and the `n` parameter is now named `ndraws`.
```
:::

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](09_notes_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-6-1.png){width=672}
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
# Tabulate the beta_1 values that exceed 0
bike_model_df %>% 
  mutate(exceeds_0 = temp_feel > 0) %>% 
  tabyl(exceeds_0)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
 exceeds_0     n percent
      TRUE 20000       1
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
# Simulate four sets of data
bikes %>%
  add_predicted_draws(bike_model, n = 4) %>%
  ggplot(aes(x = temp_feel, y = rides)) +
    geom_point(aes(y = .prediction, group = .draw), size = 0.2) + 
    facet_wrap(~ .draw)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}
```
Warning: 
In add_predicted_draws(): The `n` argument is a deprecated alias for `ndraws`.
Use the `ndraws` argument instead.
See help("tidybayes-deprecated").
```
:::

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](09_notes_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-6-2.png){width=672}
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
saveRDS(bike_model_df, "bike_model_df.RDS")
```
:::


# 9.5.1 Building a posterior predictive model


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
first_set <- head(bike_model_df, 1)
first_set
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
  (Intercept) temp_feel    sigma
1   -2593.578  87.59029 1362.773
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
mu <- first_set$`(Intercept)` + first_set$temp_feel * 75
mu
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
[1] 3975.694
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
set.seed(84735)
y_new <- rnorm(1, mean = mu, sd = first_set$sigma)
y_new
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
[1] 4884.981
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
# Predict rides for each parameter set in the chain
set.seed(84735)
predict_75 <- bike_model_df %>% 
  mutate(mu = `(Intercept)` + temp_feel*75,
         y_new = rnorm(20000, mean = mu, sd = sigma))

head(predict_75, 3)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
  (Intercept) temp_feel    sigma       mu    y_new
1   -2593.578  87.59029 1362.773 3975.694 4884.981
2   -2207.766  82.06586 1236.125 3947.173 3794.091
3   -2515.712  86.25428 1329.203 3953.359 4991.291
```
:::
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
# Construct 80% posterior credible intervals
predict_75 %>% 
  summarize(lower_mu = quantile(mu, 0.025),
            upper_mu = quantile(mu, 0.975),
            lower_new = quantile(y_new, 0.025),
            upper_new = quantile(y_new, 0.975))
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
  lower_mu upper_mu lower_new upper_new
1 3842.508 4093.436  1492.104  6488.281
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
# Plot the posterior model of the typical ridership on 75 degree days
ggplot(predict_75, aes(x = mu)) + 
  geom_density()
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](09_notes_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-8-1.png){width=672}
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
# Plot the posterior predictive model of tomorrow's ridership
ggplot(predict_75, aes(x = y_new)) + 
  geom_density()
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](09_notes_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-8-2.png){width=672}
:::
:::


# 9.5.2 Posterior prediction with rstanarm


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
# Simulate a set of predictions
set.seed(84735)
shortcut_prediction <- 
  posterior_predict(bike_model, newdata = data.frame(temp_feel = 75))

# Construct a 95% posterior credible interval
posterior_interval(shortcut_prediction, prob = 0.95)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
      2.5%    97.5%
1 1492.104 6488.281
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
# Plot the approximate predictive model
mcmc_dens(shortcut_prediction) + 
  xlab("predicted ridership on a 75 degree day")
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](09_notes_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-9-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


# 9.6 Sequential regression modeling


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
bikes %>% 
  select(date, temp_feel, rides) %>% 
  head(3)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
        date temp_feel rides
1 2011-01-01  64.72625   654
2 2011-01-03  49.04645  1229
3 2011-01-04  51.09098  1454
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
phase_1 <- bikes[1:30, ]
phase_2 <- bikes[1:60, ]
phase_3 <- bikes

my_model <- stan_glm(rides ~ temp_feel, data = phase_1, family = gaussian, 
                     prior_intercept = normal(5000, 1000),
                     prior = normal(100, 40), 
                     prior_aux = exponential(0.0008),
                     chains = 4, iter = 5000*2, seed = 84735)
```

# 9.7 Using default rstanarm priors


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
bike_model_default <- stan_glm(
  rides ~ temp_feel, data = bikes, 
  family = gaussian,
  prior_intercept = normal(5000, 2.5, autoscale = TRUE),
  prior = normal(0, 2.5, autoscale = TRUE), 
  prior_aux = exponential(1, autoscale = TRUE),
  chains = 4, iter = 5000*2, seed = 84735)
```

```{.r .cell-code}
prior_summary(bike_model_default)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
Priors for model 'bike_model_default' 
------
Intercept (after predictors centered)
  Specified prior:
    ~ normal(location = 5000, scale = 2.5)
  Adjusted prior:
    ~ normal(location = 5000, scale = 3937)

Coefficients
  Specified prior:
    ~ normal(location = 0, scale = 2.5)
  Adjusted prior:
    ~ normal(location = 0, scale = 351)

Auxiliary (sigma)
  Specified prior:
    ~ exponential(rate = 1)
  Adjusted prior:
    ~ exponential(rate = 0.00064)
------
See help('prior_summary.stanreg') for more details
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
# Perform a prior simulation 
bike_default_priors <- update(bike_model_default, prior_PD = TRUE)
```

```{.r .cell-code}
# 200 prior model lines
bikes %>%
  add_fitted_draws(bike_default_priors, n = 200) %>%
  ggplot(aes(x = temp_feel, y = rides)) +
    geom_line(aes(y = .value, group = .draw), alpha = 0.15)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}
```
Warning: `fitted_draws` and `add_fitted_draws` are deprecated as their names were confusing.
- Use [add_]epred_draws() to get the expectation of the posterior predictive.
- Use [add_]linpred_draws() to get the distribution of the linear predictor.
- For example, you used [add_]fitted_draws(..., scale = "response"), which
  means you most likely want [add_]epred_draws(...).
NOTE: When updating to the new functions, note that the `model` parameter is now
  named `object` and the `n` parameter is now named `ndraws`.
```
:::

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](09_notes_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-11-1.png){width=672}
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
# 4 prior simulated datasets
set.seed(3)
bikes %>%
  add_predicted_draws(bike_default_priors, n = 4) %>%
  ggplot(aes(x = temp_feel, y = rides)) +
    geom_point(aes(y = .prediction, group = .draw)) + 
    facet_wrap(~ .draw)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}
```
Warning: 
In add_predicted_draws(): The `n` argument is a deprecated alias for `ndraws`.
Use the `ndraws` argument instead.
See help("tidybayes-deprecated").
```
:::

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](09_notes_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-11-2.png){width=672}
:::
